title: Training a model with multiple input files
body:
Hello, 
I have traind a model with a .csv input file, and I'm trying to keep training the model with many other input files (each file contains small amount of data, and I have tons of files like this. Also, their structure is important so combining them to one file with a lot of data would lose the structer I want).
After I have sucssesfully traind a model with the first of many .csv file, I would like to keep training the same model with the other files. 
I've seen in isse #71 that --model_load_path is better for me, so for example I tried
ludwig train  --data_csv C:/Users/user/Desktop/DataSet/SecondInputFile.csv --model_load_path C:/Windows/System32/results/experiment_run_12 (the path to the model that have been created by training with the first input file)
but I get the error "ludwig train: error: one of the arguments -md/--model_definition -mdf/--model_definition_file is required".
I have tried many other constallations and none of them works.

Thank you for your help!
